title: SB 1.18.42-43 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 25-04-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: the king who is the best amongst human beings is as good as the personality of Godhead because he is trained, he represents the Supreme Lord, he acts according to the Vedic injunctions given by the Supreme Lord
segments.summary: The speaker explains verse 42, emphasizing the importance of a king's training, his representation of God, and his duty to protect citizens, highlighting how King Parikshit was glorified for his virtuous rule.

segments.key_quote: one trained Monarch is far better than hundreds of useless ministerial rogues
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the qualities of a trained monarch with the shortcomings of modern democracy, where leaders may lack proper training and qualifications, leading to the exploitation of citizens in Kali Yuga.
